reviews.title: Surprise birthday weekend !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have just come back from a wonderful week end in cefalu , I chose La Plumeria from trip advisor and it certainly lived up to it's good reviews ! It was small very clean in the centre of cefalu an ideal location , the staff were excellent as was the breakfast ! Could not fault it and it was ideal for my husbands surprise week end .
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night as a group of 4 aged 24-28, we shared a room which had 1 double bed and 2 single beds (pulled out from the armchairs). The room was spacious enough, clean and tidy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I reserved a parking space within the carpark which not too far away from the hotel, they arranged to collect us and bags and drop off at the hotel (the following day we were allowed to leave the car in the car parking until we were ready to leave Cefalu and we were again taken from the hotel to the car). Breakfast was good, teas, coffee, juice, cereal, toast, yogurts, cakes, cold meats etc. I would certainly stay here again and recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at La Plumeria at the end of September. The hotel is ideally located in the Centro Storico and is only a 5 minute walk to the beach. Due to this location, it is not advisable to drive to the hotel, even to drop off or load luggage. Rather, make sure to get detailed directions to the hotel's remote parking lot and call the hotel to send its van to meet you there. The parking lot is an easy 10 minute walk from the hotel so, once the baggage is dealt with, your car is easily accessible.
reviews.title: A real gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We travelled in June and July of 2012 with our two boys (ages 4 and 6). We visit Italy every other year. This hotel had everything an American family needs. Off site parking was easy to find, and the shuttle picked us up quickly. The hotel appears to be recently updated. It looks and feels fantastic. Plumeria’s family room was large enough for all of our luggage, clean, and functional. The boys each had their own single bed, and my wife and I were able to share a real queen bed (not two singles pushed together). The air conditioner worked well. The small balcony looked out onto a small street and allowed for great people watching, and we enjoyed listening to the locals going about their business. Staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke English well (although we prefer to speak Italian). Breakfast was an upscale version of the typical Italian fare, with the exception that we were served freshly baked cake. The restaurants and shops are a 2 minute walk. The beach is just outside the old town and 5 minute walk. We are looking forward to visiting again.
reviews.title: Family Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked two nights here, and would highly recommend this hotel. We landed in Palermo and drove directly to the hotel. They do not have parking on site, but we were directed by hotel staff (Giulia) to a parking lot, where she organized a taxi shuttle. The hotel is in an excellent location right in the old town. We were so tired (from a very long flight) that we missed breakfast the next morning. It was held for us past the breakfast hour, and we were treated to coffee and cannoli in the outdoor courtyard when we finally got up. Very nice touch.
reviews.title: Nice initiation to Sicily

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great initiation to Sicily, great hotel.
reviews.title: How a hotel should be!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at La Plumeria in July for 7 wonderful nights, infact so wonderful we have booked for 14 nights next June!! Our triple room was spotlessly clean, light & bright with a small balcony looking out over the laneway that runs along the side of the hotel. The staff are warm & friendly & happy to assist in anyway. The breakfast is great with fresh fruit, cereals, breads, ham, cheese, scrambled eggs, tomatoes etc etc & topped off with good coffee & cannoli. In summer its served in the courtyard with jazz music playing in the background. As other reviews have stated La Plumeria is right in the middle of Cefalu, the moment you walk out the door you are 1 min from something to eat & 5 mins from jumping into the sea. The staff gave us excellent restaurant suggestions, from pizza to gourmet.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!
Central with efficient staff
reviews.text: The train/bus station is an easy 10-15 mins walk away, approx 1 km.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Plumeria has a very nice atmosphere through the tasteful renovation of an old building near the city center of Cefalu. The rooms was comfortable and everything was very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good with a good selection of local and international servings.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay in cefalu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As Cefalu is a very lively city it was sometimes a bit noisy in the night/morning - you should consider that if you have a light sleep. The parking lot is about a ten-minute-walk away from the hotel but you can call to get picked up.
reviews.title: Loved it !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we can strongly recommend La Plumeria if you're going to stay at cefalu - we think it's one of the best places to stay at.
reviews.title: no complaints here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: an otherwise charming hotel in the very heart of Cefalu. My wife and I spent two nights there and we would go back in a jiffy. The staff was excellent and so genuinely friendly.
reviews.title: Best little secret in town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was excellent, and all of the staff were very pleasant. The breakfast was the nicest we had while in Sicily. However, we found our room to be very noisy, and did not get any rest while on holidays. I understand the hotel is in the centre of town and there may have been some street noise, which we were aware of and that would not have been a problem.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but very noisy plumbing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was a problem was the plumbing noises from the next room in our room, room 104. Every time the people in the next room used the shower or the toilet we could hear it very loudly in our room. The noise from the toilet was particularly bad, and every time our neighbours used the toilet we were woken up, we got very little sleep for our entire stay.
reviews.title: VERY WELCOMING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spoke to a staff member 2 days into our stay, and again when we were checking out to tell them about our problems, but was told there was nothing they could do, and they wouldn't even come to the room to hear it for themselves. It was a pity really, we had decided to treat ourselves with a stay here but left disappointed.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in Cefalu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the reception staff at this hotel very helpful, they were always friendly and able to assist with our enquiries.The hotel is centrally located in the old town with close proximity of a good choice of restaurants.The breakfasts were modest and typical of this area with lots of cakes. I would have preferred a choice of hot food.The bedroom was of a good size although no outlook.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with wonderful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in La Plumeria on Oct. 28 and Oct. 29. The hotel is beautifully restored in a 16 th century building. The staff is very helpful. Breakfast buffet is delicious. Highly recommend staying at La Plumeria. Great location!
reviews.title: Best little hotel in Cefalu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is really well located close to the town and the beach. Staff are friendly and the rooms clean. We had two very small rooms though so I suggest you specifically request larger rooms. There are no tea or coffee facilities in the room and no complimentary bottles of water. Breakfast is basic. The parking station outside of the town is not an issue however be aware it shuts from 1-5 pm. W didn't know this so it was a stressful arrival. Once you contact the hotel they send a taxi to collect you.
reviews.title: Good choice in the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I just returned from Cefalu and I am happy to report that this town and hotel was the perfect choice for us. La Plumeria is conveniently located, rooms were clean, staff very helpful and breakfast each morning was a plus. We have vowed to return. My only criticisms: improve on the purchase of towels/felt like sandpaper and parking is a nuisance. Overall, I gave this hotel an excellent rating and we would not hesitate to recommend.
reviews.title: Perfect Choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. Perfect location - in the middle of the main street, so you are sorrounded with restaurants, shops etc.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area had some problems with the water, so we didn't have any water the first night. It was fixed sometime after breakfast the next morning. Not ideal, but since it wasn't for longer, it went okay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in the amazing old town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast in Italy usually consists of sweets/different cakes. They had some bread and cheese/ham, but quite boring.
reviews.title: Excellent Location in a Beautiful Beach Town

description: La Plumeria Hotel is situated near the famous Arab-Norman Cathedral and Cefalù 's splendid sandy beach, the building's elegant façade has been, which conscientiously preserved even with the railings retained in traditional Sicilian style. The Hotel faces the Corso Ruggero, the main street of the Norman town's historical center. The renovation was completed keeping the original late-medieval style and modernizing the rooms and the public areas at the same time. The hall, the lounge bar, the characteristic courtyard and internal garden, the dining room were all architecturally re-designed keeping local traditions and all are meticulously furnished with antique Sicilian furniture.The Rooms, from the enchanting single with a small terrace facing the Cathedral to the comfortable junior Suites that can comfortably accommodate an entire family, unite tradition with technology. Each has a balcony overlooking the traditional streets or courtyards of the historical center. Our young and qualified staff, our abundant homemade Breakfast, our Services, such as high-speed WiFi available throughout the building and the Parking Lot, located outside the city center and connected to the hotel with a free shuttle service, all contribute to a pleasant stay.
